member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Attributes.Persistence.Exceptions.AttributeNameAlreadyExistsException
member.summary: Indicates that an attempt was made to save or update an attribute with a name, wich already exists in the repository.

remarks.para: Make sure you have written the name correctly. If you wish to modify the existing attribute, use to load the attribute first, then save the changes.
This exception is identified by error code HK15091.

member.name: P:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Attributes.Persistence.Exceptions.AttributeNameAlreadyExistsException.EquivalentHttpStatusCode
member.summary: If this error occurs while processing an HTTP request, the request should be terminated with a status code 409 (Conflict).

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Attributes.Persistence.Exceptions.AttributeNotFoundException
member.summary: Indicates that an attempt was made to interact with an attribute that is not defined in the given store.

remarks.para: This exception is typically raised when trying to access an attribute that does not exist in the specified store. Ensure that the correct store is being accessed.
This exception is identified by error code HK15104.

member.name: P:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Attributes.Persistence.Exceptions.AttributeNotFoundException.EquivalentHttpStatusCode
member.summary: If this error occurs while processing an HTTP request, the request should be terminated with a status code 404 (Not Found).

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Attributes.Persistence.Exceptions.AttributeTypeNotFoundException
member.summary: Indicates that an attempt was made to interact with an attribute type that is not defined in the given store.

remarks.para: Make sure that the correct store is being accessed or define the attribute type in the current store by calling or a similar overload.
This exception is identified by error code HK15089.

member.summary: If this error occurs while processing an HTTP request, the request should be terminated with a status code 404 (Not Found).

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Attributes.Persistence.Exceptions.CircularNodeTreeException
member.summary: Indicates an attempt to save or update a node that would result in an invalid tree structure. A valid tree structure does not contain circles (A grandparent of a node is also its child). Make sure that there are no circles in the node structure.

remarks.para: The root, parent and name of the node where the circle was detected.
This exception is identified by error code HK15129.

member.summary: Indicates that an attempt was made to load, save, update or delete a to or from a with an different repository or the parent or root of the node has a different repository.

remarks.para: When loading, saving, updating or deleting , the , , the parent of the node and the root of the node must be in the same repository.

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Attributes.Persistence.Exceptions.NodeAlreadyExistsException
member.summary: Indicates that an attempt was made to create a node with , and combination that already exists. Since the truple (name, parent and root) is a unique identifier for a node, you cannot have 2 Nodes with the same (name, parent and root).

remarks.para: The combination of , id of , and id of of the node has to be unique in the repository.
This exception is identified by error code HK15128.

member.summary: Indicates that a formula used during calculation referred to a custom function but no custom function with this name can be found in the directory.

remarks.para: When using custom functions in be sure to put the file with the custom function in the directory of the assemblies of HAKOM and set the to the name how you want to call the function in the .
This exception is identified by error code HK15087.

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Calculation.Exceptions.DefaultRepositoryCannotBeNullException
member.summary: Thrown when the given defaultRepositoryName is null and the formula time series doesn't have a repository name in its storage information.
member.para: Ensure, that the given defaultRepositoryName is not null and, if it is, that the given formula time series has a repository name in its storage information.
This exception is identified by error code HK15078.

member.name: P:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Calculation.Exceptions.DefaultRepositoryCannotBeNullException.EquivalentHttpStatusCode
member.summary: When this error occurs while handling an HTTP request, the response should be terminated with a 400 (Bad Request) status code.

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Calculation.Exceptions.FormulaContainsACyclicReferenceException
member.summary: Thrown when the given formula contains a cyclic reference.
member.para: Ensure, that the formula doesn't contain any cyclic references. A cyclic reference occurs, when a formula references a formula time series, which itself references the time series, containing the original formula. Since formulas can reference multiple formula time series, it's important to go through all of their references, because the formula, which completes the cycle, could be multiple "levels" down from the formula time series it references.
This exception is identified by error code HK15076.

member.name: P:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Calculation.Exceptions.FormulaContainsACyclicReferenceException.EquivalentHttpStatusCode
member.summary: When this error occurs while handling an HTTP request, the response should be terminated with a 400 (Bad Request) status code.

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Calculation.Exceptions.FormulaResultCannotBeMatchedToTimeSeriesDataException
member.summary: The result of the calculated formula cannot be matched to an object of type .

remarks.para: Make sure, that the result of the formula can be converted to an object of type .
This exception is identified by error code HK15079.

member.summary: When this error occurs while handling an HTTP request, the response should be terminated with a 400 (Bad Request) status code.

Make sure that a constructor with no paramaters is available for all custom functions.
This exception is identified by error code HK15085.

member.summary: If this error occurs while processing an HTTP request, the request should be terminated with a status code 500 (Internal Server Error).

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Calculation.Exceptions.InvalidTimeSeriesReferenceInFormulaException
member.summary: Thrown when a time series reference cannot be resolved due to to many dots or commas in the reference.

remarks.para: If the time series reference contains dots or commas in either the time series or repository name, the name must be escaped by quotation marks.
This exception is identified by error code HK15080.

member.summary: When this error occurs while handling an HTTP request, the response should be terminated with a 400 (Bad Request) status code.

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Calculation.Exceptions.MultipleCustomFunctionsWithTheSameNameException
member.summary: Indicates that an attempt was made to use a custom function but multiple custom functions have the same name.

remarks.para: When using custom functions in be sure to create only custom functions with unique "Name" properties.
This exception is identified by error code HK15083.

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Data.Persistence.TimeSeries.Exceptions.ActualDataTableNotSetException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when the table for time series data has not been set in the time series definition.

remarks.para: If the loaded for the time series to be read does not have the Table property or a configured fallback table set, the ActualTable property will be null and this exception will be thrown when reading data.
This exception is identified by error code HK15040.

member.name: P:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Data.Persistence.TimeSeries.Exceptions.ActualDataTableNotSetException.EquivalentHttpStatusCode
member.summary: If this error occurs while processing an HTTP request, the request should be terminated with a status code 500 (Internal Server Error).

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Data.Persistence.TimeSeries.Exceptions.ActualTablesForQuotationNotSetException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when the necessary tables for time series with quotations enabled has not been set in the time series definition.

remarks.para: If the loaded for the time series to be read or written does not have the property or a configured fallback table set, the property will be null and this exception will be thrown when reading or writing data. This error message is also thrown if the has not been set.
This exception is identified by error code HK15120.

member.name: P:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Data.Persistence.TimeSeries.Exceptions.ActualTablesForQuotationNotSetException.EquivalentHttpStatusCode
member.summary: If this error occurs while processing an HTTP request, the request should be terminated with a status code 500 (Internal Server Error).

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Data.Persistence.TimeSeries.Exceptions.DbDataTypeMismatchException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when a value retrieved from the database does not match the expected type.

remarks.para: The default implementation of currently supports only the double value type for . If the data retrieved from the database does not match double, an exception is thrown when reading the data.
This exception is identified by error code HK15022.

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Data.Persistence.TimeSeries.Exceptions.InvalidRepositoryException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when the repository of the differs from the repository in the given .

remarks.para: A must have the same repository as the DataStorageInformation property of the specified time series. If the DataStorageInformation is null, the StorageInformation property of the specified time series is used and compared to the specified repository. If they do not match, this exception is thrown when the Configure method of the is called.
This exception is identified by error code HK15021.

member.name: P:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Data.Persistence.TimeSeries.Exceptions.InvalidRepositoryException.EquivalentHttpStatusCode
member.summary: If this error occurs while processing an HTTP request, the request should be terminated with a status code 500 (Internal Server Error).

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Data.Persistence.TimeSeries.Exceptions.InvalidTimeSeriesException
member.summary: Abstract class for Exceptions indicating that the time series given for reading or writing time series data is invalid in the current context.

member.name: P:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Data.Persistence.TimeSeries.Exceptions.InvalidTimeSeriesException.EquivalentHttpStatusCode
member.summary: If this error occurs while processing an HTTP request, the request should be terminated with a status code 400 (Bad Request).

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Data.Persistence.TimeSeries.Exceptions.InvalidTimeSeriesExceptions.DataWriteOnFormulaTimeSeriesNotSupportedException
member.summary: Indicates that an attempt was made to write data to a formula time series, which is not supported.

remarks.para: Writing data to a time series, which has a formula configured is not supported, because reading data from a time series with a formula set calculates the formula and thus does not read the data stored for that time series. The data could therefore never be read again. You can write the data to a time series without a configured formula and reference this time series in the formula of the time series with the formula.
This exception is identified by error code HK15031.

member.name: P:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Data.Persistence.TimeSeries.Exceptions.InvalidTimeSeriesExceptions.DataWriteOnFormulaTimeSeriesNotSupportedException.EquivalentHttpStatusCode
member.summary: If this error occurs while processing an HTTP request, the request should be terminated with a status code 400 (Bad Request).

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Data.Persistence.TimeSeries.Exceptions.InvalidTimeSeriesExceptions.ReadingAuditedQuotationsForTimeSeriesWithoutPreservedHistoricDataNotPossibleException
member.summary: Indicates that an attempt was made to read from a time series where is deactivated.

remarks.para: Reading is only supported for time series where and is activated. Otherwise the necessary information is not saved.
This exception is identified by error code HK15125.

member.name: P:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Data.Persistence.TimeSeries.Exceptions.InvalidTimeSeriesExceptions.ReadingAuditedQuotationsForTimeSeriesWithoutPreservedHistoricDataNotPossibleException.EquivalentHttpStatusCode
member.summary: If this error occurs while processing an HTTP request, the request should be terminated with a status code 400 (Bad Request).

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Data.Persistence.TimeSeries.Exceptions.InvalidTimeSeriesExceptions.ReadingQuotationDataOnTimeSeriesWithoutQuotationNotSupportedException
member.summary: Indicates that an attempt was made when reading data with a quotation date from a time series that is not configured to support quotations.

remarks.para: When reading time series data with a specific quotation date, the "Quotation" property of the time series must be set to true. Only then will the quotation data be saved and can be read at that specific time. Either a time series must be selected which supports quotations or no may be used to query the data.
This exception is identified by error code HK15117.

member.name: P:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Data.Persistence.TimeSeries.Exceptions.InvalidTimeSeriesExceptions.ReadingQuotationDataOnTimeSeriesWithoutQuotationNotSupportedException.EquivalentHttpStatusCode
member.summary: If this error occurs while processing an HTTP request, the request should be terminated with a status code 400 (Bad Request).

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Data.Persistence.TimeSeries.Exceptions.InvalidTimeSeriesExceptions.ReadingQuotationsForTimeSeriesWithoutPreservedAuditLogNotPossibleException
member.summary: Indicates that an attempt was made to read from a time series where is deactivated.

remarks.para: Reading is only supported for time series where and is activated. Otherwise the necessary information is not saved.
This exception is identified by error code HK15124.

member.name: P:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Data.Persistence.TimeSeries.Exceptions.InvalidTimeSeriesExceptions.ReadingQuotationsForTimeSeriesWithoutPreservedAuditLogNotPossibleException.EquivalentHttpStatusCode
member.summary: If this error occurs while processing an HTTP request, the request should be terminated with a status code 400 (Bad Request).

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Data.Persistence.TimeSeries.Exceptions.InvalidTimeSeriesExceptions.ReadingWithHistoricDateTimeOnTimeSeriesWithoutPreserveHistoricDataNotPossibleException
member.summary: Indicates that an attempt was made when reading data with a historic date and time to a time series that has not preserve historic data enabled.

remarks.para: When reading time series data with a specific historical date, the "PreserveHistoricData" property of the time series must be set to true. Only then will the historical data be saved and can be read at that specific time. If "PreserveHistoricData" is set to false, you can read data without a specific historical date(null).
This exception is identified by error code HK15054.

member.name: P:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Data.Persistence.TimeSeries.Exceptions.InvalidTimeSeriesExceptions.ReadingWithHistoricDateTimeOnTimeSeriesWithoutPreserveHistoricDataNotPossibleException.EquivalentHttpStatusCode
member.summary: If this error occurs while processing an HTTP request, the request should be terminated with a status code 400 (Bad Request).

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Data.Persistence.TimeSeries.Exceptions.InvalidTimeSeriesExceptions.TimeSeriesQuotationDataStoreForTimeSeriesWithoutQuotationNotSupportedException
member.summary: Indicates that an attempt has been made to configure a with a time series that does not support quotations.

remarks.para: This should not happen. If this exception is thrown, the related implementation of was not registered correctly.
This exception is identified by error code HK15118.

member.name: P:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Data.Persistence.TimeSeries.Exceptions.InvalidTimeSeriesExceptions.TimeSeriesQuotationDataStoreForTimeSeriesWithoutQuotationNotSupportedException.EquivalentHttpStatusCode
member.summary: If this error occurs while processing an HTTP request, the request should be terminated with a status code 400 (Bad Request).

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Data.Persistence.TimeSeries.Exceptions.InvalidTimeSeriesExceptions.WritingDataWithoutQuotationTimeOnTimeSeriesWithQuotationIsNotPossibleException
member.summary: Indicates that an attempt was made to write data without a quotation date to a time series where quotation is enabled, which is not supported.

remarks.para: Writing data to a time series which has quotations enabled without specifying a quotation date is not supported, because the quotation date is needed for saving the data. Please provide a quotation date with the .
This exception is identified by error code HK15121.

member.name: P:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Data.Persistence.TimeSeries.Exceptions.InvalidTimeSeriesExceptions.WritingDataWithoutQuotationTimeOnTimeSeriesWithQuotationIsNotPossibleException.EquivalentHttpStatusCode
member.summary: If this error occurs while processing an HTTP request, the request should be terminated with a status code 400 (Bad Request).

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Data.Persistence.TimeSeries.Exceptions.InvalidTimeSeriesExceptions.WritingQuotationDataOnTimeSeriesWithoutQuotationNotSupportedException
member.summary: Indicates that an attempt was made when writing data with a quotation date to a time series that does not have quotations enabled.

remarks.para: When writing time series data with a specific quotation date, the "Quotation" property of the time series must be set to true.
This exception is identified by error code HK15119.

member.name: P:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Data.Persistence.TimeSeries.Exceptions.InvalidTimeSeriesExceptions.WritingQuotationDataOnTimeSeriesWithoutQuotationNotSupportedException.EquivalentHttpStatusCode
member.summary: If this error occurs while processing an HTTP request, the request should be terminated with a status code 400 (Bad Request).

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Data.Persistence.TimeSeries.Exceptions.InvalidTimeSeriesExceptions.WritingWithHistoricDateTimeOnTimeSeriesWithoutPreserveHistoricDataNotPossibleException
member.summary: Indicates that an attempt was made to write data with a historic date and time to a time series that has not preserve historic data enabled.

remarks.para: When writing time series data with a specific historical date, the PreserveHistoricData property of the time series must be set to true. Only then will the historical data be saved at that specific time. If "PreserveHistoricData" is set to false, you can write data without a specific historical date (null). This will overwrite the current time series data.
This exception is identified by error code HK15053.

member.name: P:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Data.Persistence.TimeSeries.Exceptions.InvalidTimeSeriesExceptions.WritingWithHistoricDateTimeOnTimeSeriesWithoutPreserveHistoricDataNotPossibleException.EquivalentHttpStatusCode
member.summary: If this error occurs while processing an HTTP request, the request should be terminated with a status code 400 (Bad Request).

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Data.Persistence.TimeSeries.Exceptions.StorageProviderTypeNotSupportedException
member.summary: Indicates that an was provided, which is not supported in the current storage.

remarks.para: When calling the Configure Method of the default implementation of the type of the given is checked and this exception is thrown if the is not supported.
This exception is identified by error code HK15064.

member.name: P:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Data.Persistence.TimeSeries.Exceptions.StorageProviderTypeNotSupportedException.EquivalentHttpStatusCode
member.summary: If this error occurs while processing an HTTP request, the request should be terminated with a status code 500 (Internal Server Error).

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Data.Persistence.TimeSeries.Exceptions.TimeSeriesCompressedValueTypeNotSupportedException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when an invoked method of the does not support the given value type, when dealing with compressed time series.

remarks.para: If the implementation of , or the does not support the specified value type of the data, this exception is thrown. Either create and inject classes for these interfaces or use a data type that is supported. The supported type of the default classes is string.

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Data.Persistence.TimeSeries.Exceptions.TimeSeriesDataConversionException
member.summary: Indicates that an attempt has been made to convert between two units, where one unit is null.

remarks.para: Data without a unit (null) cannot be converted to another unit. When data is written and either the unit of the data is not specified (null) or the unit of the time series is not specified (null), this exception is thrown.If the unit of the time series is not specified (null), set the unit of the data to null to avoid this error.Otherwise, specify a unit for the data that can be converted to the unit of the time series. If data is read and the unit of the time series is not specified (null), the data can only be read without a unit.If the data is read without unit (Unit property of is null), the data is returned in the unit of the time series by default.
This exception is identified by error code HK15028.

member.name: P:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Data.Persistence.TimeSeries.Exceptions.TimeSeriesDataConversionException.EquivalentHttpStatusCode
member.summary: If this error occurs while processing an HTTP request, the request should be terminated with a status code 400 (Bad Request).

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Data.Persistence.TimeSeries.Quotation.Exceptions.QuotationDefaultBehaviorConfigurationSettingNotValidException
member.summary: The configuration setting "TSM:Persistence:Data:QuotationDefaultBehavior" has an invalid value.

remarks.para:
The configuration setting "TSM:Persistence:Data:QuotationDefaultBehavior" can have one of the following values:
0Default QuotationBehavior -> defaults back to "1 - MaxExact"
1MaxExact
2MaxNotExact
3NowNotExact
Please make sure to configure one of the listed numbers.
This exception is identified by error code HK15122.

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Data.TimeSeries.Compression.CompressionMode
member.summary: In HAKOM terminology time series compression is a data storage technology, where individual time series values are cascaded to fixed sized blocks, that are binary encoded and saved to the database. The size of the blocks depends on the interval of the underlying data. The CompressionMode represents the type of compression.

member.name: M:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Data.TimeSeries.Compression.CompressionMode.Create(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of with a custom value.
member.param: The id of the compression mode.

member.name: M:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Data.TimeSeries.Compression.CompressionMode.NoCompression
member.summary: Create a new instance of representing that compression is turned off. In case of conventional - uncompressed time series, each data row consists of a timestamp, value and flag.
member.returns: a new instance of representing that compression is turned off.

member.name: M:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Data.TimeSeries.Compression.CompressionMode.Base64BlockCompression
member.summary: Create a new instance of representing a compression based on Base64 encoded blocks. Individual time series values are cascaded to fixed sized blocks that are binary encoded and saved to the database. The size of the blocks depends on the interval of the underlying data. A compressed time series with this mode does not save timestamp information for each value. Instead adjacent value-flag pairs are combined together to a block. This reduces data storage space and the database index size.
member.returns: A new instance of representing that the compression is turned on and based on Base64 encoded blocks.

member.name: M:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Data.TimeSeries.Compression.CompressionMode.Default
member.summary: Creates a new default instance of . The default instance is no compression.
member.returns: A new instance of the default (Value=default).

member.summary: The number/id representing the type of compression

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Data.TimeSeries.Exceptions.MultiPathConversionOnlySupportsFactorConversionException
member.summary: Indicates that an attempt was made to convert a time series with multiple conversion paths not only containing factors.

remarks.para: This exception is thrown if the conversion contains multiple paths (e.g. the conversion from m/s to km/h contains the conversion paths m -> km and s -> h) and at least one of these paths contains a conversion that is not factor-based (e.g. using integration, offset, or a time-based unit conversion). Make sure that each path can only use factor-based unit conversions or change either the source or the target unit.
This exception is identified by error code HK15063.

member.name: P:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Data.TimeSeries.Exceptions.MultiPathConversionOnlySupportsFactorConversionException.EquivalentHttpStatusCode
member.summary: If this error occurs while processing an HTTP request, the request should be terminated with a status code 501 (Not Implemented).

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Data.TimeSeries.Exceptions.NonCyclicStepLeftFunctionDataIsNotSupportedException
member.summary: Indicates that an attempt was made to use a combination of cyclic = false and function = .

remarks.para: The default implementation for processing data does not support data where cyclic is false and the function is . Use either data where cyclic is false and function is or data where cyclic is true.
This exception is identified by error code HK15050.

member.name: P:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Data.TimeSeries.Exceptions.NonCyclicStepLeftFunctionDataIsNotSupportedException.EquivalentHttpStatusCode
member.summary: If this error occurs while processing an HTTP request, the request should be terminated with a status code 400 (Bad Request).

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Data.TimeSeries.Exceptions.NonCyclicTimeSeriesDataCollectionConversionToTimeSeriesSpanWithoutIgnoreAsLastFlagIsNotSupportedException
member.summary: Indicates that an attempt was made to transform a non-cyclic into a collection of , without the last entry of the having the flag configured.

remarks.para: This exception is identified by error code HK15093.

member.name: P:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Data.TimeSeries.Exceptions.NonCyclicTimeSeriesDataCollectionConversionToTimeSeriesSpanWithoutIgnoreAsLastFlagIsNotSupportedException.EquivalentHttpStatusCode
member.summary: If this error occurs while processing an HTTP request, the request should be terminated with a status code 400 (Bad Request).

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Data.TimeSeries.Exceptions.TransformationIntoCyclicDataWithoutToDateNotSupportedException
member.summary: Indicates, that an attempt was made to transform non cyclic data to cyclic data but the to date is missing.

remarks.para: If is called without a to-date, but the transformation requires converting non-cyclic data to cyclic data, this exception is thrown. Specify a to-date to avoid this exception.
This exception is identified by error code HK15051.

member.name: P:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Data.TimeSeries.Exceptions.TransformationIntoCyclicDataWithoutToDateNotSupportedException.EquivalentHttpStatusCode
member.summary: If this error occurs while processing an HTTP request, the request should be terminated with a status code 400 (Bad Request).

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Data.TimeSeries.Exceptions.UnitConversionPathForUnitConversionNotFoundException
member.summary: Indicates that for the given conversion no was found.

remarks.para: When converting data from one unit to another, s must be provided to ensure a conversion path between these units. Either add a to the specified unit conversions to ensure that a conversion path between the unit of the data and the target unit is possible, or change the target unit.
This exception is identified by error code HK15056.

member.name: P:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Data.TimeSeries.Exceptions.UnitConversionPathForUnitConversionNotFoundException.EquivalentHttpStatusCode
member.summary: If this error occurs while processing an HTTP request, the request should be terminated with a status code 400 (Bad Request).

Flag ValueFlag PriorityFlag Name (Locale: en)

1240Scheduled
1980Missing
2010Accounted
2150Estimated
2270Interpolated

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Formulas.Exceptions.FormulaXmlDeserializationException
member.summary: This exception should be thrown when the deserialization of the formula fails. It should contain the Exception-Details from the deserialization exception.

remarks.para: When deserializing a formula (e.g. when reading from the store) an exception may occur, e.g. due to a bad format. This exception contains more information about which deserialization exception occurred.
This exception is identified by error code HK15004.

member.name: P:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Formulas.Exceptions.FormulaXmlDeserializationException.EquivalentHttpStatusCode
member.summary: If this error occurs while processing an HTTP request, the request should be terminated with a status code 500 (Internal Server Error).

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Formulas.Exceptions.InvalidMediaTypeParameterTimeBaseException
member.summary: This exception is thrown when the media type for the time base cannot be parsed.

remarks.para: When configuring the default implementation of the , a mediaType must be specified. If the in this mediaType is invalid (wrong format or unknown ), this exception is thrown. Specify a valid mediaType with either no (default is HakomSecond) or a valid as an integer (0 = HakomSecond; 1 = UnixSecond; 2 = UnixMillisecond).
This exception is identified by error code HK15003.

member.name: P:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Formulas.Exceptions.InvalidMediaTypeParameterTimeBaseException.EquivalentHttpStatusCode
member.summary: If this error occurs while processing an HTTP request, the request should be terminated with a status code 406 (Not Acceptable).

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Formulas.IFormulaFactory
member.summary: Used to create formulas that dynamically calculate time series data.
member.remarks:
Formulas are one or more expressions that define the data along a time series.
Each expression within the formula is applied to the time series starting from a specific date/time and is valid until it is succeeded by another expression.
Expressions along with their date/time of when they are applied are referred to as formula slices.

member.name: M:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Formulas.IFormulaFactory.Create(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a formula with a single expression that is valid starting on January 1st 1972 at 00:00h UTC+1 along the time series
member.param: The expression to use for calculation

member.name: M:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Formulas.IFormulaFactory.Create(System.DateTimeOffset,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a formula that is valid starting on the given date along the time series.
member.param: Time along the series from which the formula should be used
The expression to use for calculation

member.summary: Creates a formula with multiple expressions valid starting on the date given for each one along the time series
member.param: The expressions to use for calculation along with a date/time specifying their validity along the time series

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.IEnumeration`1
member.summary: Marker interface to characterize a struct of type as an enumeration-like data type.

remarks.para: Commonly used s are somewhat limited in several ways, i.e. it is not possible to add methods to them, extend them without code changes, specify an optimized data type for their backing value, etc.
HAKOM applications uses special s in these cases instead. A few examples of this can be found here:

member.typeparam: The type to mark as an enumeration-like data structure.

member.summary: Base interface for enumeration types such as , , etc.

member.summary: The value of the enumeration type.

member.summary: Creates an instance of with the given .
member.param: The value to create the with.

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.IEnumerationPropertyProvider`1
member.summary: Provides additional properties mapped to specific values of enumeration-like structs (i.e. , , etc.).
member.remarks: implementing types are used to represent data similarly to the way how an works, but with added functionality and sometimes even the ability to extend them via configuration. Under the hood, these types are still represented by a single value (i.e. , , etc.) to keep their memory footprint as small as possible. In order to add properties to these values without attaching them to each instance of the , implementations of this interface may be used to map values to additional information, for example a human-readable string representation, etc.
member.typeparam: The enumeration-like type for which this instance provides additional properties.

member.name: P:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.IEnumerationPropertyProvider`1.PropertyName
member.summary: The name of the property for which this instance provides values.

member.param: The value to look up the property value for
The mapped property.
member.returns: if there is a mapped property value for the given value of , otherwise.

member.name: M:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Quotations.QuotationBehavior.MaxExact
member.summary: Creates a quotation behavior, which specifies that the latest quotation date and time for the time domain will be determined and only data for that date will be read.

member.name: M:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Quotations.QuotationBehavior.MaxNotExact
member.summary: Creates a quotation behavior, which specifies that data from the time domain will be read with the respective latest quotation date and time.

member.name: M:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Quotations.QuotationBehavior.NowNotExact
member.summary: Creates a quotation behavior which specifies that data from the time domain will be read with the respective latest quotation date and time but earlier than the current time.

member.name: M:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Quotations.QuotationBehavior.Default
member.summary: Creates a new instance of that specifies no explicit behavior.

remarks.para: When reading data from a quotation time series without explicitly specifying a quotation date/time, the actual data retrieved depends on the that may be controlled by

list.item: setting the property of the time series being read
or specifying a TSM:Persistence:Data:QuotationDefaultBehavior in the applications configuration

remarks.para: in that order. If one of these is or then the next in that list is used to determine final behavior. If none of the aforementioned settings has a value that is not null or default, then is used.

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.TimeSeries.Persistence.Exceptions.AssignmentAlreadyExistsException
member.summary: Indicates that an attempt was made to assign something like an attribute to a time series even though that specific assignment already exists (i.e. that particular attribute is already assigned to that particular time series).

remarks.para: This exception is typically raised when trying to assign something like an attribute or another time series to a time series when that assignment already exists.
This exception is identified by error code HK15127.

member.name: P:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.TimeSeries.Persistence.Exceptions.AssignmentAlreadyExistsException.EquivalentHttpStatusCode
member.summary: If this error occurs while processing an HTTP request, the request should be terminated with a status code 409 (Conflict).

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.TimeSeries.Persistence.Exceptions.AssignmentNotFoundException
member.summary: Indicates that an attempt was made to interact with an assignment that is not defined in the given store.

remarks.para: This exception is typically raised when trying to access an assignment that does not exist in the specified store. Ensure that the correct store is being accessed.
This exception is identified by error code HK15105.

member.name: P:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.TimeSeries.Persistence.Exceptions.AssignmentNotFoundException.EquivalentHttpStatusCode
member.summary: If this error occurs while processing an HTTP request, the request should be terminated with a status code 404 (Not Found).

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.TimeSeries.Persistence.Exceptions.AssignmentTypeNotSupportedException
member.summary: Indicates that an attempt was made to save, load or delete the assignment of an unsupported type.

remarks.para: When saving or deleting assignments in the only supported assignment types can be saved or deleted. Currently only objects of type are supported for assignment.
This exception is identified by error code HK15045.

member.name: P:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.TimeSeries.Persistence.Exceptions.AssignmentTypeNotSupportedException.EquivalentHttpStatusCode
member.summary: If this error occurs while processing an HTTP request, the request should be terminated with a status code 500 (Internal Server Error).

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.TimeSeries.Persistence.Exceptions.InvalidStorageInformationRepositoryException
member.summary: Indicates that an attempt was made to save or delete an assignment of a time series to or from a time series with an different repository.

remarks.para: When saving or deleting assignments in the both objects (the object to be assigned and the time series to which the object is to be assigned) must be in the same repository.
This exception is identified by error code HK15049.

member.name: P:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.TimeSeries.Persistence.Exceptions.InvalidStorageInformationRepositoryException.EquivalentHttpStatusCode
member.summary: If this error occurs while processing an HTTP request, the request should be terminated with a status code 500 (Internal Server Error).

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.TimeSeries.Persistence.Exceptions.InvalidTimeSeriesIdentifierException
member.summary: Indicates that a time series operation was attempted with an invalid time series identifier.

member.name: P:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.TimeSeries.Persistence.Exceptions.InvalidTimeSeriesIdentifierException.EquivalentHttpStatusCode
member.summary: If this error occurs while processing an HTTP request, the request should be terminated with a status code 400 (Bad Request).

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.TimeSeries.Persistence.Exceptions.TimeSeriesDeletionFailedException
member.summary: Indicates that there was a failed attempt to delete a time series.

remarks.para: The deletion may have failed due to many reasons. The exact reason can be found in the .
This exception is identified by error code HK15005.

member.name: P:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.TimeSeries.Persistence.Exceptions.TimeSeriesDeletionFailedException.EquivalentHttpStatusCode
member.summary: If this error occurs while processing an HTTP request, the request should be terminated with a status code 500 (Internal Server Error).

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.TimeSeries.Persistence.Exceptions.TimeSeriesIdNotAllowedOnSaveException
member.summary: Indicates that an attempt was made to manually save a time series id.

remarks.para: The of the time series to be saved already contained an id. The id of a time series cannot be set manually. If an update was intended, use .
This exception is identified by error code HK15014.

member.name: P:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.TimeSeries.Persistence.Exceptions.TimeSeriesIdNotAllowedOnSaveException.EquivalentHttpStatusCode
member.summary: If this error occurs while processing an HTTP request, the request should be terminated with a status code 400 (Bad Request).

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.TimeSeries.Persistence.Exceptions.TimeSeriesNameAlreadyExistsException
member.summary: Indicates that an attempt was made to create a new time series with a name, that already exists in the repository.

remarks.para: The name of a new time series to be saved must be unique in this repository.
This exception is identified by error code HK15015.

member.name: P:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.TimeSeries.Persistence.Exceptions.TimeSeriesNameAlreadyExistsException.EquivalentHttpStatusCode
member.summary: If this error occurs while processing an HTTP request, the request should be terminated with a status code 409 (Conflict).

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.TimeSeries.Persistence.Exceptions.TimeSeriesNotFoundException
member.summary: Thrown when an attempt to access a non-existent time series was made.

remarks.para: Make sure the requested time series exists in the that you are using to access the time series.
This exception is identified by error code HK15039.

member.name: P:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.TimeSeries.Persistence.Exceptions.TimeSeriesNotFoundException.EquivalentHttpStatusCode
member.summary: If this error occurs while processing an HTTP request, the request should be terminated with a status code 404 (Not Found).

member.summary: Abstract class for all time series validation exceptions.

member.summary: Generates an exception with message indicating which property of the time series failed validation and adds a custom message.

member.summary: If this error occurs while processing an HTTP request, the request should be terminated with a status code 400 (Bad Request).

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.TimeSeries.Persistence.Exceptions.TimeSeriesValidationExceptions.InvalidTimeSeriesNameException
member.summary: Abstract class for time series validation exceptions stemming from incorrect naming.

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.TimeSeries.Persistence.Exceptions.TimeSeriesValidationExceptions.InvalidTimeSeriesNameExceptions.TimeSeriesNameIsEmptyException
member.summary: Indicates that there was an attempt to process or save a time series whose name is null or an empty string.

remarks.para: When saving a time series with the the name of the time series has to be a not null or empty string.
This exception is identified by error code HK15009.

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.TimeSeries.Persistence.Exceptions.TimeSeriesValidationExceptions.InvalidTimeSeriesNameExceptions.TimeSeriesNameIsPaddedWithWhiteSpaceException
member.summary: Indicates that there was an attempt to process or save a time series, containing whitespaces at the beginning or end of its name.

remarks.para: When saving a time series with the the name of the time series may not contain whitespaces at the beginning or end.
This exception is identified by error code HK15010.

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.TimeSeries.Persistence.Exceptions.TimeSeriesValidationExceptions.NonCyclicTimeSeriesCompressionNotSupportedException
member.summary: Indicates that there was an attempt to process or save a time series with cyclic false and any other than "NoCompression".

remarks.para: When saving a time series with the or writing data with the the time series with a other than "NoCompression" cannot be set to not cyclic.
This exception is identified by error code HK15008.

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.TimeSeries.Persistence.Exceptions.TimeSeriesValidationExceptions.PreserveHistoricDataOnFormulaTimeSeriesNotSupportedException
member.summary: Thrown when an attempt was made to persist a instance, which had a formula and PreserveHistoricData set to true.
member.para: When saving an instance with a formula, ensure PreserveHistoricData is not set to true.
This exception is identified by error code HK15086.

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.TimeSeries.Persistence.Exceptions.TimeSeriesValidationExceptions.PreservingHistoricDataWithoutAuditLogsNotPossibleException
member.summary: Indicates that there was an attempt to process or save a time series with historic data where preserving audit logs not enabled.

remarks.para: Preserving historic data requires the preservation of the audit logs.
This exception is identified by error code HK15115.

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.TimeSeries.Persistence.ITimeSeriesStore`1
member.summary: Defines a store used for permanently storing that can by uniquely identified by a value of type .

remarks.para: This interface extends with methods that allow for the retrieval of individual by a unique idendifier other than their name. For example, a SQL-database based time series store, may allow for retrieval of time series by their numeric primary key or an automatically assigned .
In order to use these methods, match the against this interface with the expected , then call the respective methods.
Note that different implementations may support different types of identifiers and there is no way of knowing which one is supported by the configured store at compile time.

member.name: M:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Time.DateTimes.DateTimeOffsetAtOrBefore.Parse(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Char},System.IFormatProvider)
member.summary: Parses the input span into a instance.
member.param: The input span containing the date string.
The format provider.
member.remarks:
The input string should follow the ISO 8601 format for dates and times. It may optionally end with ',exact' (or ', exact' with whitespace) to specify that the date is exact.
Supported formats:
For exact date and time: "YYYY-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss[,exact]" (e.g. "2002-06-04T14:30:00,exact")
For date only: "YYYY-MM-dd[,exact]" (e.g. "2002-06-04")
For date with additional information: "YYYY-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss,f[,exact]" (e.g. "2002-06-04T14:30:00,55")

member.name: M:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Time.Intervals.IntervalTransformationMethod.Average
member.summary: Creates a new instance of representing an 'Average' interval transformation method. The Average rule determines the average of all values, when converting to a longer interval (e.g. quarter hour to hour), or repeats the value, when converting to a shorter interval (hour to quarter hour).
member.returns: A new instance of representing an 'Average' interval transformation method (Value=2).

member.name: M:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Time.Intervals.IntervalTransformationMethod.Sum
member.summary: Creates a new instance of representing a 'Sum' interval transformation method. The Sum rule determines the sum of all values, when converting to a longer interval (e.g. quarter hour to hour), or calculates the proportional value of the given target period inside the source period (i.e. a division of the source value by the number of target data points within a given source interval), when converting to a shorter interval (hour to quarter hour).
member.returns: A new instance of representing a 'Sum' interval transformation method (Value=1).

member.name: M:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Time.Intervals.IntervalTransformationMethod.Min
member.summary: Creates a new instance of representing a 'Min' interval transformation method. The Min rule determines the minimum of all values, when converting to a longer interval (e.g. quarter hour to hour), or repeats the value, when converting to a shorter interval (hour to quarter hour).
member.returns: A new instance of representing a 'Min' interval transformation method (Value=3).

member.name: M:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Time.Intervals.IntervalTransformationMethod.Max
member.summary: Creates a new instance of representing a 'Max' interval transformation method. The Max rule determines the maximum of all values, when converting to a longer interval (e.g. quarter hour to hour), or repeats the value, when converting to a shorter interval (hour to quarter hour).
member.returns: A new instance of representing a 'Max' interval transformation method (Value=4).

member.name: M:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Time.Intervals.IntervalTransformationMethod.MostFrequently
member.summary: Creates a new instance of representing a 'MostFrequently' interval transformation method. The MostFrequently rule determines the most frequent of all values, when converting to a longer interval (e.g. quarter hour to hour), or repeats the value, when converting to a shorter interval (hour to quarter hour). If a two different values are equally frequent, the value occuring later will be taken, when converting from a shorter interval.
member.returns: A new instance of representing a 'MostFrequently' interval transformation method (Value=5).

member.name: M:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Time.Intervals.IntervalTransformationMethod.AbsMin
member.summary: Creates a new instance of representing an 'AbsMin' interval transformation method. The AbsMin rule determines the absolute (modulus of a real number) minimum of all values, when converting to a longer interval (e.g. quarter hour to hour), or repeats the value, when converting to a shorter interval (hour to quarter hour).
member.returns: A new instance of representing an 'AbsMin' interval transformation method (Value=7).

member.name: M:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Time.Intervals.IntervalTransformationMethod.AbsMax
member.summary: Creates a new instance of representing an 'AbsMax' interval transformation method. The AbsMax rule determines the absolute (modulus of a real number) maximum of all values, when converting to a longer interval (e.g. quarter hour to hour), or repeats the value, when converting to a shorter interval (hour to quarter hour).
member.returns: A new instance of representing an 'AbsMax' interval transformation method (Value=8).

members.member: Creates a new instance of representing a 'FirstValue' interval transformation method. The FirstValue rule determines the first value out of all values, when converting to a longer interval (e.g. quarter hour to hour), or repeats the value, when converting to a shorter interval (hour to quarter hour). /// A new instance of representing a 'FirstValue' interval transformation method (Value=9).

Creates a new instance of representing a 'LastValue' interval transformation method. The LastValue rule determines the last value out of all values, when converting to a longer interval (e.g. quarter hour to hour), or repeats the value, when converting to a shorter interval (hour to quarter hour). /// A new instance of representing a 'LastValue' interval transformation method (Value=10).

member.summary: Creates a new default instance of . The default instance is an average transformation method.

member.name: M:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Time.TimeZones.ITimeZone.TryGetNextDaylightSavingTransitionForDateTime(System.DateTimeOffset,System.Nullable{System.DateTimeOffset}@)
member.summary: Tries to get the next daylight saving time transition date after the given . It is possible, that the time zone used to have a daylight saving time and not anymore. In such cases, or when DST is not supported, this method will return false. Otherwise the output parameter will be set to the next transition date and the method will return true.
member.param: The used to calculate the next transition date.
The next transition date.
member.returns: True, if the next date was found, otherwise false.

member.name: M:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Time.TimeZones.ITimeZone.TryGetPreviousDaylightSavingTransitionForDateTime(System.DateTimeOffset,System.Nullable{System.DateTimeOffset}@)
member.summary: Tries to get the previous daylight saving time transition date before the given . It is possible, that the time zone used to have a daylight saving time and not anymore. In such cases, or when DST is not supported, this method will return false. Otherwise the output parameter will be set to the previous transition date and the method will return true.
member.param: The used to calculate the previous transition date.
The previous transition date.
member.returns: True, if the previous date was found, otherwise false.

member.name: T:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Time.TimeZones.ITimeZoneFactory
member.summary: Used to create time zones.

member.name: M:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Time.TimeZones.ITimeZoneFactory.CreateFromId(System.String)
member.summary:
Creates a time zone based on a given . The ID can be specified in the following formats: - Custom timezone ID - IANA ID - Window ID
Please note that the IANA and Windows timezones contain adjustment rules. On non NT platforms like Linux, BSD and Mac Os, the Windows ID will map to an equivalent IANA timezone, according to TimeZoneConverter.
IANA ID:
var ianaTimeZone = timeZoneFactory.CreateFromId("Europe/Vienna");
member.param: The IANA ID, Windows ID or UTC + offset of the time zone.

member.name: M:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Time.TimeZones.ITimeZoneFactory.TryCreateFromId(System.String,HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Time.TimeZones.ITimeZone@)
member.summary: A non throwing variant of: .
member.param: The id to use
If successful, contains the time zone.

member.name: M:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Api.Time.TimeZones.ITimeZoneFactory.CreateLocal
member.summary: Creates a time zone based on the time zone of the computer/server where the application runs.

member.name: M:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Calculation.Formulas.FormulaParser.ReferenceRegex
member.remarks:
Pattern:
(?<!references)\\[(.*?)\\]
Explanation:
Zero-width negative lookbehind.
Match the string "references" right-to-left.
Match '['.
1st capture group.
Match a character other than '\n' lazily any number of times.
Match ']'.

member.name: M:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Calculation.Formulas.FormulaParser.QuotedElementsRegex
member.remarks:
Pattern:
"(.*?)(?<!\\\\)"
Explanation:
Match '"'.
1st capture group.
Match a character other than '\n' lazily any number of times.
Zero-width negative lookbehind.
Match '\\' right-to-left.
Match '"'.

member.name: M:HAKOM.TSM.Net.Calculation.Formulas.FormulaParser.ConstantTValueAndFlagRegex
member.remarks:
Pattern:
{(.+?)\\|(\\d+?)}
Explanation:
Match '{'.
1st capture group.
Match a character other than '\n' lazily at least once.
Match '|'.
2nd capture group.
Match a Unicode digit atomically at least once.
Match '}'.
